availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Martin (Trigg Co, Ky, farmer and prov govt)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer and provisional government convention member. Maryland native. Married to Amanda M. Martin. Father of Edwin Martin, John Martin, Theodore Martin, William Martin, Ann Martin, Watson Martin. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Trigg County, Kentucky, in 1840. Farmer in Trigg County in 1850. Employed Reuben F. Harris is Trigg County in 1850. Farmer in Trigg County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, p. 308.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1, p. 326A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, p. 100.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, County, City/District, p. X
